title.value: On learning Whittle index policy for restless bandits with scalable regret
title.justification: This is the title provided at the beginning of the text.
title.quote: On learning Whittle index policy for restless bandits with scalable regret

extractions.description: The paper discusses a model-based reinforcement learning algorithm tailored for restless bandit problems. It introduces a Thompson-sampling based approach to achieve scalable regret bounds, and benchmarks its performance against the Whittle index policy.

type.justification: The paper presents numerical results to illustrate the performance of the proposed algorithm.
type.quote: We present numerical examples to illustrate the salient features of the algorithm.

name.justification: The context and problems addressed in the paper revolve around optimizing policies based on reinforcement learning techniques.
name.quote: Reinforcement learning is an attractive approach to learn good resource allocation and scheduling policies based on data when the system model is unknown.

name.justification: The primary application discussed involves resource allocation and scheduling problems.
name.quote: Resource allocation and scheduling problems arise in control of networked systems.

name.justification: The restless bandit problem, a type of multi-armed bandit problem, is central to the paper's discussion.
name.quote: Restless bandits (RBs) have emerged as a popular solution heuristic for such problems.

name.justification: The paper proposes a Thompson-sampling based learning algorithm called RB-TSDE.
name.quote: we propose a Thompson-sampling based learning algorithm for RB, which we call RB-TSDE.

is_contributed.justification: The algorithm is specifically introduced and analyzed within this paper.
is_contributed.quote: The main contribution of this paper is to characterize the regret of a general RL algorithm for general RBs. In particular, we propose a Thompson-sampling based learning algorithm for RB, which we call RB-TSDE.

is_executed.justification: The paper presents numerical examples and experimental results for the proposed algorithm.
is_executed.quote: In Sec. V, we demonstrate a numerical example of the regret of our algorithm.
